poem:
### Snow Patrol Confusion

Snow falls without rules,
names drift like flakes.
Polar Bear became 
whispers on Dundee streets—
identity reshaped, 
Snow Patrol in the white, 
20,000 fingers thrust high,
headlights through frosted fog.
Not yellow, but 
a thick flurry of forgotten, frozen 
moments.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The first rule is don’t talk about patrolling the snow. We were originally called Polar Bear. I was at Dundee university and saw a friend of mine on the street who said, “How’s your band going? How’s Snow Patrol?” I was like: “Man, we’re called Polar Bear. I don’t know". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
